meanings.definition: The quality or state of being able to be machined.
meanings.sent1: The machineability of this metal allows it to be easily shaped into various parts.
meanings.sent2: The technician assessed the machineability of the new material before starting the production process.
meanings.sent3: The machineability of the clay made it a favorite choice for the pottery class.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had a machineability that transformed ordinary objects into works of art.
meanings.sent5: The machineability of the wood was so high that carving intricate designs was effortless.

meanings.definition: The ease with which a material can be machined.
meanings.sent1: The machineability of the plastic made it the ideal choice for the manufacturing process.
meanings.sent2: Engineers consider the machineability of different metals when selecting materials for a project.
meanings.sent3: The machineability of the cheese surprised the chef, who used it to create unique shapes for a dish.
meanings.sent4: His skill in negotiation had a machineability that allowed him to navigate complex deals effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The machineability of the fabric made it perfect for intricate embroidery work.
